meanings.definition: To dig up (a body) from the ground.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist carefully disinters the ancient remains for study.
meanings.sent2: The cemetery caretaker disinters the coffin to make space for a new burial.
meanings.sent3: The curious dog tries to disinters buried bones in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The detective disinters the truth from layers of deception.
meanings.sent5: The gardener disinters the hidden treasure of long-forgotten bulbs.

meanings.sent1: The journalist disinters the corruption scandal that was hidden for years.
meanings.sent2: The sunrise disinters the beauty of the landscape, revealing vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The comedian disinters a hilarious joke from the depths of his memory.
meanings.sent4: The artist disinters emotions through the strokes of a brush.
meanings.sent5: The researcher disinters valuable information from old archives.
